Time Division Multiplexing (TDM)

Is FDM good? no since the spectrum of PAM is spreading across a wide range on the frequency domain.

The time offset: in which is the total number of signals, is the index of signals (starting from 1).

Imagine a tuner switching with interval .

The ending part: each signal has a LPF together with Equalizer. For they are LTI: make the collection of the signals go through the equalizer first then LPF each other. If the LPF is in the collection part: there are overlap between different signals. The filtered signal has no meaning. The LPF is targeting signal with sampling interval .

PCM (Pulse Coded Modulation)

In PAM the takes continuous values on discrete time.

Introduce the Quantization to reduce the demodulation error, while brings the quantization error.

Idea: approximate infinite number of analog values to finite number of values.

Quantization

The quantization process is accomplished by applying an step function to the message.

step size:

where is the number of levels. The error will be smaller than the half of the step size:

Advantage: robust to noises

Encoding

Finite possibilities: encode using bits.

The number of bits: .

Methods

  1. Unipolar NRZ (non-return-to-zero)

    range from 0 to 1, with no return gap between binary values.

    Drawback: (with bipolar NRZ): mean > 0, has nonzero DC term.

  2. Bipolar NRZ

    range from -1 to 1, -1 denotes 0, and no return to 0.

    Mean = 0

  3. Unipolar RZ

    Easier for synchronization than NRZ. Larger bandwidth is required.
